originalText.text: We did roaming from our original center to the Columbus Square location and it was great! Super supportive and informative, both of our kids had a blast and kept talking about the new friends they met in "the big city". The guides did their best to make our kids feel like home! In one instance, my son asked to know what time we're going to pick him up and the guide called us so she could give him the most accurate response, this warmed my heart.

originalText.text:
Lost a student that was 3 years old. Child was locked in a restroom, when mom came to pick up.

Teachers let students do as they please. Very expensive, lack of student focus. Everything is about money.

The school also got shut down 3 times in 2023. There is only one class open and all the teachers in it hate it.

originalText.text:
Reviews

Guidepost Columbus Square Montessori is, in my opinion, one of the best educations you could give your preschooler! Not only is it a fully rounded extremely well crafted, 100+ year foundation, but it is also fun and stimulating for families. Let’s breakdown why. First, it’s about the heads of the school, Emily and Disha, they’ve worked so hard to creat an environment of love, caring and attentiveness for the teachers and students to work within. Their attention to detail is outstanding, and their constant communication with each and every family is above and beyond. Next, it’s about the teachers, ALL of them are high level educators well versed in the methodology behind Montessori and Guidepost is the most original practice you’ll find. We get weekly updates about not only the individual progress our child is achieving, but we also get classroom information and pictures. And to top that off, I have daily conversations with them at drop off, so I feel more supported on this journey, and trust me, as a mom, that’s priceless! Now for the facility—- WOW OH WOW this place is STUNNING. Bright sunny SPACIOUS classrooms complete with a rooftop terrace and garden and basement that is extraordinary, library, play space, huge mat for classes and kids kitchen and arts and crafts section! It’s brand new, they’ve truly built this space to be the ultimate happy place for our children. If you’re considering this school for your child, know that you have chosen the very BEST!

originalText.text: My child started go to Guidepost Columbus at 18 month. We were debating nanny or daycare for a while. We are so happy that we made the right choice by choosing this school. The facility is clean and beautiful, the guides are warm and knowledgable. Receiving my child's photos and update is also the highlight of our day! We highly recommend the school for any family looking for a quality 1st school experience for your child.

originalText.text:
Guidepost Montessori at Columbus Square is excellent, with very supportive staff and teachers who immediately solve any problems. They are always happy to help.
My 4 yo child attends this school and he loves it. Coursework is challenging enough to challenge advanced kids, and the teachers are compassionate enough to help those who are still learning. The staff works hard to ensure that the students feel seen and cared for. Academics and social emotional learning go hand in hand.
Guidepost Montessori at Columbus Square is a great choice for parents who are considering enrolling their child.
